Description: Rim sherd of Attic red-figured pottery skyphos; interior glazed black; exterior: red-figure decoration consisting of upper part of youth with long hair, to left (chest in three-quarter view); sketchy anatomical markings in dilute brown on chest and arm; preliminary sketch on arm and chest; some of tresses in dilute brown.
Producer name: Attributed to: Painter of Louvre CA 1849
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vessel as British Museum 1886,0401.1316 (E153.1).
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (E153.2)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XIII, no. 14)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0357) (Phase 1)
